Comment and analysis on the big stories of the day in Ireland and abroad with a panel of guests covering the key issues.
Jeff Goodwin uncovers serious problems at a local residential home and things start to go off the rails - but how will this affect the doctors' big day?
A rotating panel comprised of women from the entertainment and journalism worlds discuss issues from a female perspective, from politics and current affairs to all the latest gossip.
Brian Dowling and his fashion-forward design team continue their mission to prove to the nation that it is possible achieve a dream home renovation at little cost.
The work never slows at Sydney Airport, whether it's changing a wind sock, painting a runway at midnight or putting out a potentially catastrophic fire.
Nostalgic medical drama spin-off from Heartbeat. A mining accident puts Dr Goodwin's reputation at risk when he investigates some unconventional cures.
Matron finds a simple solution when the members of a jazz band falls ill. An old friend of Ormerod's suspects his wife is trying to kill him.
A lively mix of celebrity chat with national and international guests, fabulous food from the countrys top Chefs, expert advice and all the unmissable stories making the headlines
The unfiltered realities Irish people face in the search for a home, taking a look at the emotional rollercoaster, challenges and hard-won joys of buying a property.
An examination of the top news and entertainment events of 2000 set to music.
Two planes hit the Twin Towers in New York; the foot-and-mouth outbreak; Eamon Dunphy tries television presenting.
The five-time Paralympian tells us about her life as an elite swimmer and her journey to gold in Rio 2016.

Ainsley is joined by Briony May Williams and Gaz Oakley in the kitchen garden at Tyntesfield in Somerset for an al fresco cook off.
Three fashionistas compete with one another during a shopping spree with the hope of winning a blind date with a fashion savvy single person.
Roman Kemp hosts this quiz show with sidekick Sarah Greene. The contestants race on moving podiums across the studio floor to try to win £5,000.

The busy Christmas airport is thrown into jeopardy with the discovery of an unidentified white powder on board an incoming flight.
Nostalgic medical drama. A face from the past spells trouble for Klein; Brigid makes a decision about her future; and Ormerod and Weatherill decide to break up.
Medical drama series. A farming accident turns out to be something more serious, and Dr Ormerod is called to a party of fossil hunters trapped on the cliffs.

Roy Keane and Mick McCarthy have their famous disagreement; Bertie Ahern leads Fianna Fail to victory in the general election.
A series which chronicles the news and events of the past 20 years, all set to music. This episode looks back at the year 2003.
Paul McGrath played at three major tournaments throughout Irelands golden era. He relives a club and international career and his battles on and off the field.
Michael Carruth talks about his life inside and outside of the boxing ring and that faithful night in 1992 when he became the first Irishman to win an Olympic Gold medal in boxing.

Dating series. In Cardiff, three singletons go up against each other in a series of shopping challenges to win the affections of Mr Gay Wales 2017, Ben Brown.
